page.title: 02THE CASTLE AT DEVIZES.
page.content: Devizes Castle may best be described as a Victorian folly built in 1860 by Robert Valentine Leach.It was bought in 1950,the lead removed from the roof and the building converted into one main flat with nineteen rooms,owned by Mrs.Kemp and two smaller flats. The Castle is thought to be haunted,a ghost having been sighted by a member of the Kemp family. The main flat still uses oil stoves and large open fires and the Castle is connected to the mains for electricity and drainage. Surrounding the buildings are extensive grounds of three acres mainly grass and shrubs,the upkeep of which is shared by the tennants. During the last war,the Italians were imprisoned between its walls.
